result.execSummary:
The defendant Shelly N. Tomlinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs paid in full from cash bond.

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Must obtain/maintain full-time employment at the discretion of the agent.
Defendant must provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Shall commence immediately.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin immediately.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence

Letter to defendant
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Shelly N. Tomlinson in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Shelly N. Tomlinson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied. Joint recommendation on record by Ms. Tlusty.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Counts 1, 2, & 3.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently. Court reads in and dismisses Counts 4 & 5.  Court finds DE guilty on Count 1 and orders a withheld sentence:  DE placed on probation for 3 years with conditions of:  4 months in Taylor County Jail with Huber; DNA sample and surcharge; court costs; AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations; attend any counseling recommended by agent; obtain and maintain full time employment.  Court finds DE guilty on Counts 2 & 3 and orders a withheld sentence:  DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions of:  Court costs on each count; Letter of apology to the victim within 30 days and to be preapproved by agent on Count 2; AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations; attend any counseling recommended by agent; obtain and maintain full time employment.  Sentence credit of 33 days. ba
